t: Zephaniah 1
The*p word of the Lord*s that came to Zephaniah son of Cushi, the son of Gedaliah, the son of Amariah, the son of Hezekiah, during the reign of Josiah son of Amon king of Judah:
Judgment on the Whole Earth in the Day of the Lord
“I*pn will sweep away everything from*ld the face of the earth,” declares*ld the Lord.*s

“I*pn will sweep away both man and beast; I*ld will sweep away the birds in the sky and*ld the fish in the sea— and*ld the idols that cause the wicked to stumble.” “When*pn I destroy all mankind on*ld the face of the earth,” declares*ld the Lord,*s
“I*pn will stretch out my hand against Judah and*ld against all who live in Jerusalem. I*ln will destroy every remnant of Baal worship in this place, the*ld very names of the idolatrous priests—
those*ln who bow down on the roofs to*ld worship the starry host, those*ln who bow down and swear by the Lord*s and*ld who also swear by Molek,
those*ln who turn back from following the Lord*s and*ld neither seek the Lord*s nor inquire of him.”
Be*pn silent before the Sovereign Lord,*s for*ld the day of the Lord*s is near. The*ln Lord*s has prepared a sacrifice; he*ld has consecrated those he has invited.
“On*pn the day of the Lord’s*s sacrifice I*ld will punish the officials and*ld the king’s sons and*ln all those clad in*ld foreign clothes.
On*ln that day I will punish all*ld who avoid stepping on the threshold, who*ln fill the temple of their gods with*ld violence and deceit.
“On*pn that day,” declares*ld the Lord,*s “a*ln cry will go up from the Fish Gate, wailing*ld from the New Quarter, and*ld a loud crash from the hills.
Wail,*ln you who live in the market district; all*ld your merchants will be wiped out, all*ld who trade with silver will be destroyed.
At*ln that time I will search Jerusalem with lamps and*ld punish those who are complacent, who*ld are like wine left on its dregs, who*ln think, ‘The Lord*s will do nothing, either*ld good or bad.’
Their*ln wealth will be plundered, their*ld houses demolished. Though*ln they build houses, they*ld will not live in them; though*ln they plant vineyards, they*ld will not drink the wine.”
The*pn great day of the Lord*s is near— near*ld and coming quickly. The*ln cry on the day of the Lord*s is bitter; the*ld Mighty Warrior shouts his battle cry.
That*ln day will be a day of wrath— a*ld day of distress and anguish, a*ld day of trouble and ruin, a*ld day of darkness and gloom, a*ld day of clouds and blackness—
a*ld day of trumpet and battle cry against*ln the fortified cities and*ld against the corner towers.

“I*pn will bring such distress on all people that*ld they will grope about like those who are blind, because*ld they have sinned against the Lord.*s Their*ln blood will be poured out like dust and*ld their entrails like dung.

Neither*ln their silver nor their gold will*ld be able to save them on*ld the day of the Lord’s*s wrath.” In*pn the fire of his jealousy the*ld whole earth will be consumed, for*ln he will make a sudden end of*ld all who live on the earth.
Zephaniah 2
Judah and Jerusalem Judged Along With the Nations
Judah Summoned to Repent
Gather*pn together, gather yourselves together, you*ld shameful nation,
before*ln the decree takes effect and*ld that day passes like windblown chaff, before*ln the Lord’s*s fierce anger comes*ld upon you, before*ln the day of the Lord’s*s wrath comes*ld upon you.
Seek*ln the Lord,*s all you humble of the land, you*ld who do what he commands. Seek*ln righteousness, seek humility; perhaps*ld you will be sheltered on*ld the day of the Lord’s*s anger.
Philistia
Gaza*pn will be abandoned and*ld Ashkelon left in ruins. At*ln midday Ashdod will be emptied and*ld Ekron uprooted.
Woe*ln to you who live by the sea, you*ld Kerethite people; the*ln word of the Lord*s is against you, Canaan,*ld land of the Philistines. He*ln says, “I will destroy you, and*ld none will be left.”
The*ln land by the sea will become pastures having*ld wells for shepherds and*ld pens for flocks.

That*ln land will belong to*ld the remnant of the people of Judah; there*ld they will find pasture. In*ln the evening they will lie down in*ld the houses of Ashkelon. The*ln Lord*s their God will care for them; he*ld will restore their fortunes.
Moab and Ammon
“I*pn have heard the insults of Moab and*ld the taunts of the Ammonites, who*ln insulted my people and*ld made threats against their land.

Therefore,*ln as surely as I live,” declares*ld the Lord*s Almighty, the*ld God of Israel, “surely*ln Moab will become like Sodom, the*ld Ammonites like Gomorrah— a*ln place of weeds and salt pits, a*ld wasteland forever. The*ln remnant of my people will plunder them; the*ld survivors of my nation will inherit their land.”
This*pn is what they will get in return for their pride, for*ld insulting and mocking the*ld people of the Lord*s Almighty.
The*ln Lord*s will be awesome to them when*ld he destroys all the gods of the earth. Distant*ln nations will bow down to him, all*ld of them in their own lands.
Cush
“You*pn Cushites, too, will*ld be slain by my sword.”
Assyria
He*pn will stretch out his hand against the north and*ld destroy Assyria, leaving*ln Nineveh utterly desolate and*ld dry as the desert.

Flocks*ln and herds will lie down there, creatures*ld of every kind. The*ln desert owl and the screech owl will*ld roost on her columns. Their*ln hooting will echo through the windows, rubble*ld will fill the doorways, the*ld beams of cedar will be exposed.

This*ln is the city of revelry that*ld lived in safety. She*ln said to herself, “I*ld am the one! And there is none besides me.” What*ln a ruin she has become, a*ld lair for wild beasts! All*ln who pass by her scoff and*ld shake their fists.
Zephaniah 3
Jerusalem
Woe*pn to the city of oppressors, rebellious*ld and defiled!
She*ln obeys no one, she*ld accepts no correction. She*ln does not trust in the Lord,*s she*ld does not draw near to her God.
Her*ln officials within her are*ld roaring lions; her*ln rulers are evening wolves, who*ld leave nothing for the morning.
Her*ln prophets are unprincipled; they*ld are treacherous people. Her*ln priests profane the sanctuary and*ld do violence to the law.
The*ln Lord*s within her is righteous; he*ld does no wrong. Morning*ln by morning he dispenses his justice, and*ld every new day he does not fail, yet*ld the unrighteous know no shame.
Jerusalem Remains Unrepentant

“I*pn have destroyed nations; their*ld strongholds are demolished. I*ln have left their streets deserted, with*ld no one passing through. Their*ln cities are laid waste; they*ld are deserted and empty.

Of*ln Jerusalem I thought, ‘Surely*ld you will fear me and*ld accept correction!’ Then*ln her place of refuge would not be destroyed, nor*ld all my punishments come upon her. But*ln they were still eager to*ld act corruptly in all they did.

Therefore*ln wait for me,” declares*ld the Lord,*s “for*ld the day I will stand up to testify. I*ln have decided to assemble the nations, to*ld gather the kingdoms and*ln to pour out my wrath on them— all*ld my fierce anger. The*ln whole world will be consumed by*ld the fire of my jealous anger.
Restoration of Israel’s Remnant
“Then*pn I will purify the lips of the peoples, that*ld all of them may call on the name of the Lord*s and*ld serve him shoulder to shoulder.
From*ln beyond the rivers of Cush my*ld worshipers, my scattered people, will*ld bring me offerings.

On*ln that day you, Jerusalem, will not be put to shame for*ld all the wrongs you have done to me, because*ln I will remove from you your*ld arrogant boasters. Never*ln again will you be haughty on*ld my holy hill.
But*ln I will leave within you the*ld meek and humble. The*ln remnant of Israel will*ld trust in the name of the Lord.*s
They*ln will do no wrong; they*ld will tell no lies. A*ln deceitful tongue will*ld not be found in their mouths. They*ln will eat and lie down and*ld no one will make them afraid.”
Sing,*pn Daughter Zion; shout*ld aloud, Israel! Be*ln glad and rejoice with all your heart, Daughter*ld Jerusalem!
The*ln Lord*s has taken away your punishment, he*ld has turned back your enemy. The*ln Lord,*s the King of Israel, is with you; never*ld again will you fear any harm.
On*ln that day they*ld will say to Jerusalem, “Do*ln not fear, Zion; do*ld not let your hands hang limp.
The*ln Lord*s your God is with you, the*ld Mighty Warrior who saves. He*ln will take great delight in you; in*ld his love he will no longer rebuke you, but*ld will rejoice over you with singing.”
“I*pn will remove from you all*ld who mourn over the loss of your appointed festivals, which*ld is a burden and reproach for you.

At*ln that time I will deal with*ld all who oppressed you. I*ln will rescue the lame; I*ld will gather the exiles. I*ln will give them praise and honor in*ld every land where they have suffered shame.

At*ln that time I will gather you; at*ld that time I will bring you home. I*ln will give you honor and praise among*ld all the peoples of the earth when*ln I restore your fortunes before*ld your very eyes,” says*ld the Lord.*s
